The boll weevil (Anthonomus grandis) is a beetle which feeds on cotton buds and 
flowers. Thought to be native to Central Mexico, it migrated into the United States 
from Mexico in the late 19th century and had infested all U.S. cotton-growing 
areas by the 1920s, devastating the industry and the ... It remains the most 
destructive cotton pest in North America.
